meanings.definition: Having or relating to only one pole or kind of polarity.
meanings.sent1: The unipolar magnet only attracted metal on one side.
meanings.sent2: The battery had a unipolar charge, making it easy to insert.
meanings.sent3: The unipolar compass always pointed in the wrong direction, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her unipolar personality made it hard for her to see different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The unipolar light switch could only turn the lights on, never off.

meanings.definition: Involving or exhibiting only one pole or kind of polarity.
meanings.sent1: The unipolar neuron fired signals in one direction only.
meanings.sent2: The unipolar battery was simple to use in the device.
meanings.sent3: The unipolar weather forecast always predicted sunny days, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: His unipolar view on politics made it hard for him to compromise.
meanings.sent5: The unipolar magnet only attracted metal on one side, demonstrating its singular polarity.
